Authors: Aryanto R., Apriliyanti S., Simamora B.H., So I.G.
Title: Advertising personality impact to education institution brand image base on three hits theory of exposure
Affiliations: School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Aryanto, R., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University11530, Indonesia; Apriliyanti, S., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University11530, Indonesia; Simamora, B.H., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University11530, Indonesia; So, I.G., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University11530, Indonesia
Abstract: This research conducted to examine the causal effects of two dimensional design of print advertisement communication personality in tutoring course education institution base on brand personality that beneficially applied toward tutoring education institution brand image. After conducting observation of three groups of participants with different information advertisement treatment i.e., sincerity personality, excitement personality and control group, in the longitudinal three weeks experiment using One-Way ANOVA randomized block design analysis, gathered in the context of case study. It is proven that sincerity advertisement treatment is not appropriate to apply in making information and advertisement design for this case if publish more than one time broadcast. Contrarily, for the excitement personality form of advertisement treatment appear to increase influence on the brand image aggregate for three weeks, means excitement personality design of advertisement will strengthened the three hits theory. These research outcomes, when applied to education institution will providers, will help in designing appropriate personality form of information and communication of advertisement. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Advertisement personality; Brand image; Experimental study; Three hits theory
References: (2012) Archipelago Economy: Unleashing Indonesia’s Pontential, , McKinsey and Company; (2011) Strategic Plan 2010–2014, , Direktorat Jenderal Pendidikan Tinggi; Madden, T.J., Fehle, F., Fournier, S., (2006) Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science, 34, p. 224; Azoulay, A., Kapferer, J.N., (2003) Brand Management, 11, p. 143; Aaker, J.L., (1997) Journal of Marketing Research, 34, p. 347; Aaker, J.L., Fournier, And Brasel, S., (2004) Journal of Consumer Research, p. 31; Fletcher, G., Simpson, J.A., Thomas, G., Giles, L., (1999) Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 76, p. 72; Vakratsas, D., Ambler, T., (1999) Journal of Marketing, 63, p. 26; Altschiller, D., (2000) Brand Week, 41, p. 32; Ouwersloot, H., Tudorica, A., (2001) Maastricht Academic Center for Research in Services; Sciffman, L., Kanuk, L.L., (2008) Consumer Behavior, , 7th edn., Indeks, Jakarta; Keller, K.L., (2012) Strategic Brand Management, , 4th edn., Prentice Hall; Fournier, S., (1998) Journal of Consumer Research, 24, p. 343; Freling, T.H., Forbes, L.P., (2005) Journal of Product and Brand Management, 14, p. 404; Ekinci, Y., Hosany, S., (2006) Journal of Travel Research, 45, p. 127; Burmann, And Maloney, S., (2008) Brand Management Palgrave-Journal, 15, p. 157; Williams, S.L., Moffitt, M.A., (1997) Journal of Public Relations Research, 9, p. 237; Dowling, G.R., (2001) Creating Corporate Reputations, Identity, Image and Performance, , Oxford University Press, Oxford; Belch, G., Belch, M., An Investigation of the Effects of Repetition on Cognitive and Affective Reactions to Humorous and Serious Television Commercials San Diego State University (1984) Advances in Consumer Research, 11, pp. 4-10; Fang, X., Singh, S., Ahluwalia, R., (2007) Journal of Consumer Research
